intro: Achyrophorus saldensis, commonly known as the Saldensian fireweed, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Onagraceae family, which includes species such as willows and evening primroses. The plant is characterized by its striking red and orange flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to cold, harsh environments. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
